info.title: P4TG REST-API
info.description: Documentation of the REST-API of P4TG. Developed by Steffen Lindner (steffen@steffen-lindner.net) and Fabian Ihle (fabian.ihle@uni-tuebingen.de).

get.summary:
Method called on GET /histogram
Returns the histogram configuration of all RX ports.

200.description: Returns the histogram configuration of all RX ports.

post.summary:
Method called on POST /histogram
Configures the histogram settings for the specified RX dev port.

get.summary:
Online endpoint
Returns the currently configured ports

200.description: Restarts the currently running traffic generation.

400.description: No traffic generation is running that could be restarted.

get.summary: Returns the current statistics such as traffic rates, frame types, etc.
Returns the content of the P4 tables

200.description: Returns the content of various P4 tables.

get.summary: Returns the current statistics over time with one data point per second.

Method called on GET /trafficgen
Returns the currently configured traffic generation

200.description: Returns the currently configured traffic generation.

202.description: Returned when no traffic generation is configured.

post.summary:
Method called on POST /trafficgen
Starts the traffic generation with the specified settings in the POST body

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: If set to true, only the current test will be skipped.

200.description: Stops the currently running traffic generation.

app_rx_l2.description:
L2 receive rate per stream and port.
The number corresponds to the app_id in the Stream description.

app_tx_l2.description:
L2 send rate per stream and port.
The number corresponds to the app_id in the Stream description.

elapsed_time.description: Elapsed time since the traffic generation has started in seconds.

frame_size.description: Frame size statistics that are divided in (lower, upper) sections.

frame_type_data.description: Statistics what kind of packets have been received per port

iats.description: Statistics of the inter arrival times per port.

out_of_order.description: Number of out of order packets per port.

packet_loss.description: Number of lost packets per port.

rtt_histogram.description: RTT histogram data per port and per bin.

rtts.description: Statistics of the round trip times per port.

sample_mode.description:
Indicates whether the sample mode is used or not.
In sampling mode, IATs are sampled and not calculated in the data plane.
It is recommended to don't use the sample mode to get more precise values

Encapsulation.description:
Describes the supported encapsulations of P4TG.
Currently, MPLS, VLAN, QinQ, and SRv6 are supported.

[Encapsulation::None] corresponds to plain Ethernet | IP packet.

config.description: The configuration object. It holds the minimum and maximum value, and the number of bins.

port.description: The dev port number to configure the histogram on.

mae.description:
Mean absolute error. Only calculated if sample mode is false.
This value is directly calculated in the data plane.

mean.description:
Mean value. Either based on samples or computed in the data plane.
See sample mode.

n.description: Number of IAT samples. Only valid if sample mode is true.

std.description: Standard deviation. Only calculated if sample mode is true.

ip_dst_mask.description:
Mask that is used to randomize the IP dst address.
255.255.255.255 means that all bytes in the IP address are randomized.

ip_src_mask.description:
Mask that is used to randomize the IP src address.
255.255.255.255 means that all bytes in the IP address are randomized.

ipv6_dst_mask.description:
Mask that is used to randomize the IP dst address. The 48 least-significant bits can be randomized.
::ff:ffff:ffff means that the 48 least significant bits in the IP address are randomized.

ipv6_src_mask.description:
Mask that is used to randomize the IP src address. The 48 least-significant bits can be randomized.
::ff:ffff:ffff means that the 48 least significant bits in the IP address are randomized.

tc.description: Traffic class field of this MPLS LSE

RangeCountValue.description:
Stores the number of packets that have been received with frame size
in a given range

high.description: upper bound on the frame size

low.description: lower bound on the frame size

packets.description: number of packets with lower bound <= packet size <= upper bound

count.description: Number of packets in this bin.

probability.description: Probability for this bin based on total_pkt_count.

data_bins.description: HashMap with bin index as key and bin count with probability as value.

mean_rtt.description: Mean RTT calculated from the histogram data.

missed_bin_count.description: Number of packets not matched to any bin.

percentiles.description: HashMap with percentiles and their values.

std_dev_rtt.description: Standard deviation calculated from the histogram data.

total_pkt_count.description: Total number of packets matched to bins.

previous_statistics.description:
Save previous statistics, where the key is the test number of the statistics.
Skip serializing if there are no previous statistics.

app_id.description:
Application id number. This number is used to configure the traffic generator.
App ids 1-7 are possible for streams.

batches.description: Sends more bursty traffic resulting in a more accurate rate

burst.description: Maximal allowed burst (= packets). Burst = 1 is used for IAT precision mode, Burst = 100 for Rate precision.

frame_size.description: L2 frame size of the stream.

generation_accuracy.description: These values are set by P4TG when the stream is generated to indicate the applied configuration.

ip_version.description: Determines the IP version, either v4 or v6. Option to make it backward compatible

n_packets.description: These values are set by P4TG when the stream is generated to indicate the applied configuration.

n_pipes.description: These values are set by P4TG when the stream is generated to indicate the applied configuration.

number_of_lse.description: Number of MPLS LSEs in this stream. The value has to equal the length of the MPLS stack in a stream setting.

number_of_srv6_sids.description:
Number of SIDs in SRv6 header. At maximum 4 can be used.
A flag to indicate if there is another IP tunnel following the SRv6 headers

stream_id.description:
Identifies the stream. The same value is used in stream settings to
configure that stream for an individual port

timeout.description: These values are set by P4TG when the stream is generated to indicate the applied configuration.

traffic_rate.description: Traffic rate in Gbps that should be generated.

vxlan.description: Flag that indicates if traffic should be encapsulation in VxLAN

active.description: Indicates if this stream setting is active.

mpls_stack.description: An MPLS stack to be combined with Encapsulation = MPLS. The length of the MPLS stack has to equal the number_of_lse parameter in each Stream.

port.description: Egress port to which the stream should be sent.

stream_id.description: ID of the stream. This stream_id maps to the stream_id in the Stream description.

out_of_order.description: Number of out of order packets per port.

packet_loss.description: Number of lost packets per port.

rtts.description: Statistics of the round trip times per port.

TrafficGenData.description: Represents the body of the GET / POST endpoints of /trafficgen

duration.description: The duration of this test in seconds.

histogram_config.description: Mapping between RX port and histogram config.

mode.description: Generation mode that should be used.

name.description: The name of the test. This is used to identify the test in the UI.

port_tx_rx_mapping.description:
Mapping between TX (send) ports, and RX (receive) ports.
Traffic send on port TX are expected to be received on port RX.

stream_settings.description:
List of stream settings that should be applied.
This also configures which streams are replicated to which ports.

TypeCount.description: Stores the number of packet types that have been sent / received.

tags.name: P4TG REST-API
tags.description: Documentation of the REST-API of P4TG.
